summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to T-Mobile US, Inc., demanding subscriber records for a specific IP address from August 10, 2019, and call detail information from January 1, 2014 onward. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction of justice, and includes a request for confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Scheduled date for T-Mobile's custodian of records to appear before the grand jury, though appearance is not required if records are produced by the return date.

events.title: IP Address Activity
events.description: Specific date and time (08:44:55 EDT) for which IP address subscriber information is requested, indicating a focus on activity around this time.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
4 Sylvan Way, Parsippany, NJ 07054 (T-Mobile US, Inc. address)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets T-Mobile for subscriber records linked to a specific IP address active on August 10, 2019, at 08:44:55 EDT, as part of a grand jury investigation.
The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), 1519 (obstruction of justice), and 2 (aiding and abetting).
The request seeks extensive subscriber data including identity, contact info, payment details, and call records from January 1, 2014, to the present (August 2019).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested T-Mobile to voluntarily keep the subpoena confidential to avoid interfering with the investigation.
The subpoena reference number is 2019R01059, and it was issued on August 14, 2019, by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.
